title: The Ethnic Cleansing of Palestine
author: Ilan Pappé
description: Israeli historian's meticulously documented account of the 1948 Nakba, using declassified Israeli archives to prove the systematic expulsion of Palestinians was planned.

title: The Question of Palestine
author: Edward Said
description: Said's seminal work on Palestinian identity and the struggle for self-determination against Zionist colonialism.

title: Gaza: An Inquest into Its Martyrdom
author: Norman Finkelstein
description: Comprehensive documentation of Israel's repeated assaults on Gaza and the humanitarian catastrophe.

title: The Hundred Years' War on Palestine
author: Rashid Khalidi
description: A history of settler colonialism and resistance in Palestine from 1917 to the present, drawing on family archives.

title: Palestinian Identity: The Construction of Modern National Consciousness
author: Rashid Khalidi
description: Traces the emergence of Palestinian national identity from the late Ottoman period.

title: On Palestine
author: Noam Chomsky and Ilan Pappé
description: Two leading intellectuals discuss the past, present, and future of the Palestinian struggle.

title: The Iron Cage: The Story of the Palestinian Struggle for Statehood
author: Rashid Khalidi
description: Analysis of why Palestinian attempts at state-building have repeatedly failed due to external constraints.

title: Justice for Some: Law and the Question of Palestine
author: Noura Erakat
description: Legal scholar examines how international law has been weaponized against Palestinians.

title: Freedom Is a Constant Struggle: Ferguson, Palestine, and the Foundations of a Movement
author: Angela Davis
description: Draws connections between Black liberation in the US and Palestinian liberation.

title: The Biggest Prison on Earth: A History of the Occupied Territories
author: Ilan Pappé
description: Documents the systematic Israeli policies that turned the West Bank and Gaza into open-air prisons.

title: Ten Myths About Israel
author: Ilan Pappé
description: Debunks foundational myths used to justify Zionist colonization and ethnic cleansing.

title: Against the Loveless World
author: Susan Abulhawa
description: Novel following a Palestinian woman from Kuwait to Jordan to Palestine to an Israeli prison.

title: Mornings in Jenin
author: Susan Abulhawa
description: Epic novel spanning four generations of a Palestinian family from the Nakba to the present.

title: Gaza Writes Back: Short Stories from Young Writers in Gaza, Palestine
author: Refaat Alareer (editor)
description: Collection of stories by young Gazan writers offering firsthand accounts of life under siege.

title: A Child in Palestine: The Cartoons of Naji al-Ali
author: Naji al-Ali
description: Collection of political cartoons featuring Handala, the iconic symbol of Palestinian resistance.

title: Returning to Haifa
author: Ghassan Kanafani
description: Novella about a Palestinian couple returning to their home in Haifa after 1967, finding it occupied by Israelis.

title: Men in the Sun
author: Ghassan Kanafani
description: Novella about Palestinian refugees trying to reach Kuwait, a powerful allegory of displacement.

title: Palestine: A Four Thousand Year History
author: Nur Masalha
description: Comprehensive history of Palestine from the Bronze Age to the present, countering Zionist erasure.

title: The Palestinians: From Peasants to Revolutionaries
author: Rosemary Sayigh
description: Oral histories of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon documenting peasant life and politicization.

title: Expulsion of the Palestinians: The Concept of 'Transfer' in Zionist Political Thought
author: Nur Masalha
description: Documents how ethnic cleansing was central to Zionist ideology from the beginning.

title: The Great Hunger: Ireland 1845-1849
author: Cecil Woodham-Smith
description: Definitive account of the Irish Famine as a man-made catastrophe of British colonial policy.

title: Bobby Sands: Nothing But an Unfinished Song
author: Denis O'Hearn
description: Biography of the IRA hunger striker who died in 1981 British prison, sparking international outrage.

title: Writings from Prison
author: Bobby Sands
description: Collection of poems, writings and diary entries from Bobby Sands during his imprisonment and hunger strike.

title: Rebel Hearts: Journeys Within the IRA's Soul
author: Kevin Toolis
description: Investigation into the motivations and experiences of IRA volunteers.

title: Armed Struggle: The History of the IRA
author: Richard English
description: Comprehensive history of the Irish Republican Army from 1916 to the peace process.

title: Say Nothing: A True Story of Murder and Memory in Northern Ireland
author: Patrick Radden Keefe
description: Investigation into the Troubles through the disappearance of Jean McConville and the price of peace.

title: A Secret History of the IRA
author: Ed Moloney
description: Detailed insider account of the IRA's strategy from the 1970s through the peace process.

title: Ten Men Dead: The Story of the 1981 Irish Hunger Strike
author: David Beresford
description: Account of the ten republicans who died on hunger strike in 1981, using smuggled communications.

title: Lethal Allies: British Collusion in Ireland
author: Anne Cadwallader
description: Documents British state collusion with loyalist death squads in the murder of Catholics.

title: Unfinished Business: State Killings and the Quest for Truth
author: Bill Rolston
description: Examines state killings and the struggle for truth about British violence in Ireland.

title: The Informer
author: Liam O'Flaherty
description: Classic novel about an IRA informer in post-independence Dublin.

title: Milkman
author: Anna Burns
description: Booker Prize-winning novel set during the Troubles in Belfast.

title: The Irish War of Independence
author: Michael Hopkinson
description: Comprehensive military history of the 1919-1921 war against British rule.

title: Labour in Irish History
author: James Connolly
description: Connolly's analysis of Irish history from a socialist perspective, linking national and class liberation.

title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
author: James Joyce
description: Joyce's semi-autobiographical novel of Stephen Dedalus rejecting Irish Catholic nationalism.

title: Curfewed Night: A Frontline Memoir of Life, Love and War in Kashmir
author: Basharat Peer
description: Memoir of growing up during the Kashmiri uprising against Indian occupation.

title: The Meadow: Kashmir 1995 - Where the Terror Began
author: Adrian Levy and Cathy Scott-Clark
description: Investigation into the kidnapping of Western tourists in Kashmir and its aftermath.

title: Kashmir: The Case for Freedom
author: Tariq Ali et al.
description: Collection of essays making the case for Kashmiri self-determination.

title: Until My Freedom Has Come: The New Intifada in Kashmir
author: Sanjay Kak (editor)
description: Collection documenting the 2010 Kashmiri uprising against Indian occupation.

title: The Dragon in the Land of Snows: A History of Modern Tibet Since 1947
author: Tsering Shakya
description: Comprehensive history of Tibet from independence to Chinese occupation.

title: Tibet: A History
author: Sam van Schaik
description: Covers Tibetan history from the seventh century to the present occupation.

title: Fire Under the Snow: True Story of a Tibetan Monk
author: Palden Gyatso
description: Memoir of a Tibetan monk imprisoned and tortured for 33 years by Chinese authorities.

title: Self-Immolation as Protest in Tibet
author: John Whalen-Bridge (editor)
description: Academic analysis of the wave of Tibetan self-immolations protesting Chinese rule.

title: A People Without a Country: The Kurds and Kurdistan
author: Gerard Chaliand (editor)
description: Foundational collection on Kurdish history, culture, and struggle for self-determination.

title: The Kurds: A Modern History
author: Michael Gunter
description: Overview of Kurdish history and politics across Turkey, Iraq, Iran, and Syria.

title: Blood and Belief: The PKK and the Kurdish Fight for Independence
author: Aliza Marcus
description: History of the PKK and the Kurdish armed struggle in Turkey.

title: Democratic Confederalism
author: Abdullah Öcalan
description: Öcalan's political philosophy developed in Turkish prison, influencing Rojava.

title: Revolution in Rojava: Democratic Autonomy and Women's Liberation in Syrian Kurdistan
author: Michael Knapp, Anja Flach, and Ercan Ayboga
description: Documentation of the revolutionary experiment in Syrian Kurdistan.

title: The PKK: Coming Down from the Mountains
author: Paul White
description: Analysis of the PKK's transformation from Marxist guerrillas to democratic confederalists.

title: Endgame in the Western Sahara: What Future for Africa's Last Colony?
author: Toby Shelley
description: Analysis of the Western Sahara conflict and prospects for resolution.

title: Western Sahara: War, Nationalism, and Conflict Irresolution
author: Stephen Zunes and Jacob Mundy
description: Comprehensive study of the Western Sahara conflict and international dimensions.

title: Sahara: A Natural History
author: Marq de Villiers and Sheila Hirtle
description: History and ecology of the Sahara including the Western Sahara conflict.

title: Long Walk to Freedom
author: Nelson Mandela
description: Mandela's autobiography from childhood through imprisonment to presidency.

title: No Easy Walk to Freedom
author: Nelson Mandela
description: Collection of Mandela's speeches and writings from the struggle against apartheid.

title: I Write What I Like
author: Steve Biko
description: Collection of writings by Black Consciousness leader murdered by apartheid police.

title: The Struggle Is My Life
author: Nelson Mandela
description: Speeches and writings documenting Mandela's political evolution.

title: Cry, the Beloved Country
author: Alan Paton
description: Novel about a Black pastor searching for his son in apartheid South Africa.

title: July's People
author: Nadine Gordimer
description: Novel imagining the collapse of apartheid as white family flees to servant's village.

title: Burger's Daughter
author: Nadine Gordimer
description: Novel about daughter of white anti-apartheid activists coming to political consciousness.

title: The Wretched of the Earth
author: Frantz Fanon
description: Fanon's analysis of colonialism and decolonization, highly influential in South Africa.

title: A Dying Colonialism
author: Frantz Fanon
description: Analysis of the Algerian revolution and transformation of colonized society.

title: The Battle of Algiers
author: Saadi Yacef
description: Memoir by FLN leader who organized urban guerrilla warfare against French colonizers.

title: A Savage War of Peace: Algeria 1954-1962
author: Alistair Horne
description: Comprehensive history of the Algerian War of Independence.

title: The Question
author: Henri Alleg
description: French communist's account of being tortured by French paratroopers in Algeria.

title: The Murmur of Dreams
author: Ahlam Mosteghanemi
description: Novel exploring love and loss in post-independence Algeria.

title: Kill Anything That Moves: The Real American War in Vietnam
author: Nick Turse
description: Documents systematic US atrocities in Vietnam beyond My Lai.

title: The Pentagon Papers
author: Daniel Ellsberg
description: Leaked documents revealing US government lies about the Vietnam War.

title: Fire in the Lake: The Vietnamese and the Americans in Vietnam
author: Frances FitzGerald
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning analysis of Vietnamese culture and the US war.

title: Vietnam: A History
author: Stanley Karnow
description: Comprehensive history of Vietnam and US involvement.

title: The Things They Carried
author: Tim O'Brien
description: Collection of linked stories about American soldiers in Vietnam.

title: Dispatches
author: Michael Herr
description: Gonzo journalism memoir of covering the Vietnam War.

title: King Leopold's Ghost: A Story of Greed, Terror, and Heroism in Colonial Africa
author: Adam Hochschild
description: Documents the atrocities of Belgian colonialism in the Congo Free State.

title: The Congo from Leopold to Kabila: A People's History
author: Georges Nzongola-Ntalaja
description: History of Congo from colonial exploitation through independence struggles.

title: The Assassination of Lumumba
author: Ludo De Witte
description: Documents Belgian and CIA involvement in the murder of Patrice Lumumba.

title: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
description: Novella exposing Belgian atrocities in the Congo, though problematic in its portrayal of Africans.

title: Late Victorian Holocausts: El Niño Famines and the Making of the Third World
author: Mike Davis
description: Documents how British policies turned droughts into mass famines killing tens of millions.

title: Inglorious Empire: What the British Did to India
author: Shashi Tharoor
description: Comprehensive indictment of British colonialism's destruction of India.

title: The Discovery of India
author: Jawaharlal Nehru
description: Nehru's exploration of Indian history and civilization written in British prison.

title: Hind Swaraj
author: Mohandas Gandhi
description: Gandhi's critique of Western civilization and vision for Indian self-rule.

title: Midnight's Children
author: Salman Rushdie
description: Booker Prize-winning novel about children born at Indian independence.

title: Train to Pakistan
author: Khushwant Singh
description: Novel about partition violence in a village on the India-Pakistan border.

title: Open Veins of Latin America: Five Centuries of the Pillage of a Continent
author: Eduardo Galeano
description: Classic analysis of Latin American exploitation by European and US imperialism.

title: The Motorcycle Diaries
author: Che Guevara
description: Guevara's memoir of his transformative journey across South America.

title: Guerrilla Warfare
author: Che Guevara
description: Guevara's manual on revolutionary guerrilla tactics.

title: Pedagogy of the Oppressed
author: Paulo Freire
description: Brazilian educator's foundational text on critical pedagogy and liberation.

title: The Shock Doctrine: The Rise of Disaster Capitalism
author: Naomi Klein
description: Documents how crises are exploited to impose neoliberal capitalism.

title: We Say No: Chronicles 1963-1991
author: Eduardo Galeano
description: Collection of Galeano's journalism and essays on Latin American politics.

title: Memory of Fire Trilogy
author: Eduardo Galeano
description: Three-volume alternative history of the Americas from indigenous perspective.

title: Black Skin, White Masks
author: Frantz Fanon
description: Fanon's analysis of the psychological effects of colonialism on the colonized.

title: Discourse on Colonialism
author: Aimé Césaire
description: Martinican poet's powerful indictment of European colonialism.

title: Orientalism
author: Edward Said
description: Foundational text of postcolonial studies on Western representations of the 'Orient'.

title: Culture and Imperialism
author: Edward Said
description: Extends Orientalism to examine imperialism in Western culture broadly.

title: Decolonising the Mind: The Politics of Language in African Literature
author: Ngũgĩ wa Thiong'o
description: Kenyan writer's argument for African languages over colonial English.

title: Neocolonialism: The Last Stage of Imperialism
author: Kwame Nkrumah
description: Ghanaian leader's analysis of how imperialism continues after formal independence.

title: How Europe Underdeveloped Africa
author: Walter Rodney
description: Guyanese historian's analysis of how colonialism impoverished Africa.

title: Women, Race & Class
author: Angela Davis
description: Intersectional analysis of women's liberation, race, and class struggle.

title: Sister Outsider
author: Audre Lorde
description: Essays and speeches by Black lesbian feminist poet on difference and liberation.

title: This Bridge Called My Back: Writings by Radical Women of Color
author: Cherríe Moraga and Gloria Anzaldúa (editors)
description: Groundbreaking anthology of writings by women of color.

title: Caliban and the Witch: Women, the Body and Primitive Accumulation
author: Silvia Federici
description: Feminist analysis of witch hunts as primitive accumulation targeting women's bodies.

title: Feminism for the 99%: A Manifesto
author: Cinzia Arruzza, Tithi Bhattacharya, and Nancy Fraser
description: Manifesto for anti-capitalist, internationalist feminism.

title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
author: Malcolm X with Alex Haley
description: Malcolm X's life story from street hustler to revolutionary leader.

title: Revolutionary Suicide
author: Huey P. Newton
description: Black Panther co-founder's autobiography and political philosophy.

title: Assata: An Autobiography
author: Assata Shakur
description: Autobiography of Black Liberation Army member now in exile in Cuba.

title: Blood in My Eye
author: George Jackson
description: Revolutionary writings from prison by Black Panther leader killed at San Quentin.

title: Soledad Brother: The Prison Letters of George Jackson
author: George Jackson
description: Letters from prison documenting Jackson's political awakening.

title: The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness
author: Michelle Alexander
description: Documents how mass incarceration functions as racial caste system.

title: Are Prisons Obsolete?
author: Angela Davis
description: Makes the case for prison abolition.

title: A People's History of the United States
author: Howard Zinn
description: US history from the perspective of workers, women, and minorities.

title: The Making of the English Working Class
author: E.P. Thompson
description: Foundational social history of English working class formation.

title: The Jungle
author: Upton Sinclair
description: Muckraking novel exposing conditions in Chicago's meatpacking industry.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: Novel following Dust Bowl migrants to California during the Great Depression.

title: Strike!
author: Jeremy Brecher
description: History of mass strikes in America from 1877 to 1970.

title: Anti-Dühring
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Engels' systematic presentation of Marxism covering philosophy, political economy, and socialism.

title: The Origin of the Family, Private Property and the State
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Engels' analysis of the historical emergence of the family, private property, and the state.

title: Socialism: Utopian and Scientific
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Accessible introduction to scientific socialism distinguishing it from utopian socialism.

title: The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx's analysis of the 1851 French coup, containing famous passages on history repeating.

title: The Civil War in France
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx's analysis of the Paris Commune as the first workers' state.

title: Critique of the Gotha Programme
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx's critique of the German workers' party program, outlining transition to communism.

title: The Poverty of Philosophy
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx's critique of Proudhon and early articulation of historical materialism.

title: What Is To Be Done?
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin's argument for a vanguard party to lead the revolutionary movement.

title: Materialism and Empirio-criticism
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin's philosophical defense of materialist epistemology against Machism.

title: Left-Wing Communism: An Infantile Disorder
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin's critique of ultra-left tactics and defense of strategic flexibility.

title: The Development of Capitalism in Russia
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin's economic analysis of Russian capitalist development and class formation.

title: Two Tactics of Social-Democracy in the Democratic Revolution
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin's strategy for the 1905 Russian Revolution and the role of the proletariat.

title: The History of the Russian Revolution
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's monumental history of the 1917 revolution he helped lead.

title: The Revolution Betrayed
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's analysis of Stalinist bureaucratic degeneration in the Soviet Union.

title: The Permanent Revolution
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's theory of permanent revolution and combined and uneven development.

title: Literature and Revolution
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's analysis of the relationship between art, literature, and revolution.

title: My Life
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's autobiography covering his revolutionary career.

title: Their Morals and Ours
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky's defense of revolutionary morality against bourgeois hypocrisy.

title: Reform or Revolution
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg's polemic against reformism in the German Social Democratic Party.

title: The Mass Strike, the Political Party and the Trade Unions
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Analysis of the mass strike as revolutionary weapon based on 1905 Russian experience.

title: The Accumulation of Capital
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg's analysis of capitalist imperialism and its need for non-capitalist markets.

title: The Russian Revolution
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg's critique of Bolshevik policies while defending the revolution.

title: The Junius Pamphlet
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg's anti-war pamphlet written in prison, founding document of Spartacus League.

title: Prison Notebooks
author: Antonio Gramsci
description: Gramsci's fragmentary writings on hegemony, civil society, and revolutionary strategy.

title: Selections from the Prison Notebooks
author: Antonio Gramsci
description: Key selections from Gramsci's prison writings on politics and culture.

title: The Modern Prince
author: Antonio Gramsci
description: Gramsci's notes on the revolutionary party as the modern equivalent of Machiavelli's prince.

title: On Contradiction
author: Mao Zedong
description: Mao's philosophical essay on dialectics and the analysis of contradictions.

title: On Practice
author: Mao Zedong
description: Mao's epistemological essay on the relationship between knowledge and practice.

title: On Guerrilla Warfare
author: Mao Zedong
description: Mao's classic text on guerrilla warfare strategy and tactics.

title: On Protracted War
author: Mao Zedong

title: Report on an Investigation of the Peasant Movement in Hunan
author: Mao Zedong
description: Mao's influential report on peasant revolutionary potential.

title: Mutual Aid: A Factor of Evolution
author: Peter Kropotkin
description: Kropotkin's argument that cooperation is as important as competition in evolution.

title: The Conquest of Bread
author: Peter Kropotkin
description: Kropotkin's vision of anarchist communist society and how to achieve it.

title: Fields, Factories and Workshops
author: Peter Kropotkin
description: Kropotkin's analysis of decentralized, integrated economic production.

title: God and the State
author: Mikhail Bakunin
description: Bakunin's critique of religion and the state as forms of authority.

title: Statism and Anarchy
author: Mikhail Bakunin

title: What Is Property?
author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon
description: Proudhon's famous work declaring 'property is theft' and outlining mutualism.

title: Homage to Catalonia
author: George Orwell

title: The Spanish Civil War
author: Hugh Thomas

title: Dialectic of Enlightenment
author: Theodor Adorno and Max Horkheimer

title: One-Dimensional Man
author: Herbert Marcuse
description: Marcuse's critique of advanced industrial society's suppression of opposition.

title: Eros and Civilization
author: Herbert Marcuse
description: Marcuse's synthesis of Marx and Freud, imagining non-repressive civilization.

title: Minima Moralia
author: Theodor Adorno
description: Adorno's aphoristic reflections on damaged life under late capitalism.

title: History and Class Consciousness
author: Georg Lukács
description: Foundational text of Western Marxism on reification and class consciousness.

title: The Theory of the Novel
author: Georg Lukács
description: Lukács' early analysis of the novel as expression of transcendental homelessness.

title: Being and Nothingness
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
description: Sartre's magnum opus on existentialist philosophy.

title: Critique of Dialectical Reason
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
description: Sartre's attempt to synthesize existentialism and Marxism.

title: Search for a Method
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
description: Sartre's essay on the relationship between existentialism and Marxism.

title: The Second Sex
author: Simone de Beauvoir
description: Foundational feminist text analyzing women's oppression and 'becoming woman'.

title: The Ethics of Ambiguity
author: Simone de Beauvoir
description: Beauvoir's existentialist ethics and its political implications.

title: Reading Capital
author: Louis Althusser
description: Althusser's structuralist reading of Marx's Capital.

title: For Marx
author: Louis Althusser
description: Althusser's essays on the scientific character of Marxism.

title: The German Ideology Today
author: Louis Althusser
description: Althusser's essay on ideology and ideological state apparatuses.

title: Hegemony and Socialist Strategy
author: Ernesto Laclau and Chantal Mouffe

title: Empire

title: The Communist Horizon
author: Jodi Dean
description: Argument for returning to communism as political horizon.

title: The Modern World-System I
author: Immanuel Wallerstein
description: Wallerstein's analysis of the emergence of the capitalist world-economy.

title: The Development of Underdevelopment
author: Andre Gunder Frank
description: Frank's dependency theory analysis of Latin American underdevelopment.

title: Unequal Exchange
author: Arghiri Emmanuel
description: Analysis of how international trade transfers value from periphery to core.

title: Accumulation on a World Scale
author: Samir Amin

title: Eurocentrism

description: Amin's critique of Eurocentrism in social theory and its ideological function.

title: The Ecology of Freedom
author: Murray Bookchin

title: Post-Scarcity Anarchism
author: Murray Bookchin

author: Naomi Klein

title: Fossil Capital

author: Andreas Malm

title: Less Is More: How Degrowth Will Save the World
author: Jason Hickel

author: Mark Fisher

title: Ghosts of My Life

author: David Graeber

title: Bullshit Jobs: A Theory
author: David Graeber

author: Peter Marcuse and David Madden

author: Norman Finkelstein

author: Norman Finkelstein

title: Gaza in Crisis
author: Noam Chomsky and Ilan Pappé

title: Blaming the Victims

title: After the Last Sky: Palestinian Lives

author: W.E.B. Du Bois

title: The Souls of Black Folk
author: W.E.B. Du Bois

title: Darkwater: Voices from Within the Veil

title: Black Power: The Politics of Liberation
author: Stokely Carmichael and Charles V. Hamilton

author: Angela Davis

title: Black Macho and the Myth of the Superwoman

title: Ain't I a Woman: Black Women and Feminism
author: bell hooks

author: Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor

author: Keeanga-Yamahtta Taylor (editor)

author: Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz

author: Ned Blackhawk
